title: Waymo Pays DoorDash Drivers to Close Robotaxi Doors: An Innovative Pilot Project
summary:
In an unexpected but intriguing pilot project, Waymo, the autonomous vehicle division of Alphabet, has partnered with DoorDash, the popular food delivery service. This project, currently being conducted in Atlanta, sees Waymo paying DoorDash drivers to close the doors of their robotaxis that have been accidentally left open by passengers. This initiative is not only an innovative solution to a small but bothersome problem but also illustrates the growing integration of autonomous technology into our daily lives.

The partnership was revealed when a Reddit user, who works for DoorDash, shared a post about an unusual task they had received: closing a Waymo robotaxi door for $11.25. The task included a $6.25 guarantee upon acceptance and a $5 bonus upon completion. This initiative is part of a broader pilot project by Waymo aimed at improving the efficiency and reliability of their autonomous vehicles.

Waymo's robotaxis are currently available in six U.S. cities, including San Francisco, Los Angeles, Austin, Atlanta, Phoenix, and Miami. With expansions planned for new markets such as the UK and Japan, this project is a step in the right direction to address potential issues before they impact the user experience. The collaboration with DoorDash is a smart move, leveraging an existing workforce to solve a specific problem, saving both costs and time.

One of the key benefits of this project is the flexibility it offers to both Waymo and DoorDash. For Waymo, it means a quick and effective solution to a problem that could otherwise affect the efficiency of their fleet. For DoorDash drivers, it provides an additional source of income, especially for those working near Waymo's operations. This initiative also highlights the growing trend of the gig economy, where different companies collaborate to offer new and innovative services.

While this project is currently limited to Atlanta, it serves as an example of how autonomous technology and the gig economy can work together to solve problems and create new opportunities. It is an innovative approach that not only improves the efficiency of Waymo's robotaxis but also enhances the lives of DoorDash drivers by providing them with extra income. This project is a step in the right direction and shows how technology and collaboration can create new possibilities in a rapidly changing world.

Waymo's future plans include integrating an automatic door-closing function in their future vehicles, although the exact timeline has not been specified. This suggests that while the current project is a temporary solution, Waymo is actively working on technology that will eliminate this problem in the future. In the meantime, the collaboration with DoorDash provides a practical and effective solution to a problem that could otherwise hinder the growth and efficiency of their autonomous vehicles.

The partnership between Waymo and DoorDash is an example of how companies can collaborate to find innovative solutions to complex problems. It also underscores the growing role of the gig economy in improving the efficiency and reliability of new technologies. With Waymo's services expanding to new markets and continuous innovation in autonomous technology, this project is a step in the right direction for both Waymo and the gig economy as a whole.

title: Ernie Hudson at 80: 'My goal is simple - I just want to stay alive'
summary: On his 80th birthday, Ernie Hudson, the beloved actor from 'Ghostbusters', shares his simple yet powerful life philosophy: 'My biggest goal is to just stay alive.' Hudson, who recently celebrated his 80th birthday, a milestone he never expected to reach, emphasizes the importance of regular exercise and a healthy lifestyle for his well-being and long-term health. In a recent interview with Men's Health, Hudson opened up about his journey to longevity and the simple yet powerful life philosophy that has helped him stay in top shape at his age. Hudson, known for his role as Winston Zeddemore in the classic film 'Ghostbusters', is an example of how maintaining an active lifestyle and listening to your body can contribute to a long and healthy life. Hudson told Men's Health that he works out regularly, usually two to three times a week with a personal trainer, and uses his son as a workout partner when he's traveling or in New York City. His training focuses on improving and maintaining his upper body strength, with exercises like push-ups, seated rows, and bench presses. Hudson also emphasizes the importance of flexibility and mobility, especially at an older age. 'The older you get, the more important it is to stay flexible, so you're not stumbling and falling down, which is the number one hazard,' he said. Hudson has long been serious about his workouts and does a set of push-ups and stretches daily to maintain his flexibility. He also does Pilates weekly to improve his mobility. Hudson also stresses the importance of a healthy diet, especially when he's busy with work. 'You can work out all you want, but if you aren't in control of your diet, you're going to have a problem,' he said. Hudson's life philosophy is simple yet powerful: listen to your body, stay active, and eat healthily. By following these simple steps, Hudson has managed to stay in top shape and pursue his passion for acting at the age of 80. Hudson's story is an inspiration to anyone looking for ways to lead a long and healthy life. title: Anthropic's CEO: We're in the 'centaur phase' of software engineering
summary:
Dario Amodei, CEO of Anthropic, has made a notable comparison to describe the collaboration between humans and artificial intelligence (AI). He likens it to the mythological creature, the centaur, a combination of human and horse. This comparison is not only poetic but also technically relevant, as it reflects the current phase of software development where human engineers and AI work together to achieve better results.

In a recent interview on the podcast "Interesting Times with Ross Douthat," Amodei elaborates on his stance. He uses the example of chess to make his point. Fifteen to twenty years ago, a human checking an AI's output could beat an AI or a human player alone. Now, AI can beat humans without that human oversight. This transition, Amodei says, is also applicable to software engineering. "We're already in our centaur phase for software," he states. "During that centaur phase, if anything, the demand for software engineers may go up. But the period may be very brief."

Amodei is, however, concerned about the "big disruption" that entry-level white-collar work might undergo. He warns that this change is not comparable to previous economic revolutions, such as the shift from agriculture to factory work to knowledge work, which took place over centuries or decades. "This is happening over a number of years," he says.

Amodei is one of the most prominent voices warning that AI could displace some white-collar jobs, particularly in law, finance, and consulting. In a January essay, he predicted that AI could disrupt 50% of entry-level jobs within one to five years. Other leaders of top AI labs, such as Mustafa Suleyman and Demis Hassabis, have made similar comments about advanced AI automating service jobs within the next 18 months.

Despite these warnings, there are also positive voices. Execs at some software companies argue that AI will boost engineer productivity and that companies will need more of them. "The companies that are the smartest are going to hire more developers," said GitHub CEO Thomas Dohmke in a July podcast. "I think the idea that AI without any coding skills lets you just build a billion-dollar business is mistaken." Atlassian's CEO Mike Cannon-Brookes added that while AI advances, people will keep coming up with new ideas for the technology they want, and engineers will be needed to build it. "Five years from now, we'll have more engineers working for our company than we do today," he said in an October interview. "They will be more efficient, but technology creation is not output-bound."

These developments show that while AI will have a significant impact on the job market, it will also create new opportunities and growth possibilities. It is a transition that needs to be carefully managed to ensure that the benefits of AI are optimized and the negative effects are minimized. The future of software engineering seems to be one where human creativity and AI efficiency will go hand in hand, much like the centaur, a symbiotic relationship that will challenge and expand the boundaries of what is possible.

title: Rivian CEO Predicts Self-Driving Cars as Standard by 2030
summary: Rivian CEO RJ Scaringe has made a remarkable prediction about the future of self-driving cars. During an interview on the 'No Priors' podcast, released on Thursday, Scaringe stated that it will be 'inconceivable' to buy a car that cannot drive itself by 2030. This statement underscores the growing confidence in the rapid development and adoption of autonomous vehicle technology. Scaringe compares the future norm of self-driving cars to current standard vehicle features like airbags and air conditioning, which were once optional. He emphasizes that within a few years, it will be hard to imagine buying a car that cannot drop you off at the airport or pick up your kids from school. This vision is not only optimistic but also ambitious, implying that technology and regulation will significantly evolve within a decade. Rivian, a pioneer in the U.S. market for electric vehicles, is determined to shape this future. The company recently reported an 8% increase in annual revenue for 2025 compared to 2024, with revenue of $5.39 billion and 42,247 vehicles delivered. This growth is a sign of the increasing acceptance of electric vehicles and the anticipated transition to autonomous technology. Rivian's R2 SUV, their cheapest EV to date, is expected to be delivered later this year, priced at $45,000. This expansion of their product line is strategic, as it can further democratize the market for autonomous vehicles. However, the competition is fierce, with U.S. companies like Tesla and Waymo, as well as Chinese competitors such as BYD and XPeng. Despite the challenges, Rivian remains focused on innovation and growth. The recent drop in stock price after the earnings release, followed by a rise in after-hours trading, reflects the market's volatility but also the potential for long-term success. Scaringe's vision goes beyond just the ability to drive themselves; he aims for vehicles that can perform routine tasks such as shopping or ordering spare parts. This ambition underscores the potential of autonomous technology to transform daily life. As the world looks towards a future where self-driving cars are the norm, Rivian remains a key player in this revolution. Their continuous innovation and growth are a sign of the excitement and potential of the autonomous vehicle sector. The road to 2030 will bring challenges, but with companies like Rivian leading the way, the future of self-driving cars seems not only possible but inevitable.

title: Self-consumption of solar power increases by 30 percent thanks to home battery
summary: A recent study by the Vereniging Eigen Huis has shown that the self-consumption of solar power has increased by 30 percent thanks to the installation of home batteries. This is a significant result that highlights the impact of home batteries on the energy efficiency of households with solar panels. The study, which was conducted among a wide range of households, shows that the combination of solar panels and home batteries offers a powerful solution for optimizing energy use and reducing dependence on the public electricity grid. Energy expert Bram reacted positively to the results and emphasized the importance of this development for the future of sustainable energy. 'These results are promising and show that home batteries can play a crucial role in improving the energy efficiency of households,' said Bram. 'It is an important step towards a more sustainable future.' The Vereniging Eigen Huis emphasized, however, that the payback period of home batteries is still a difficult subject. Although the initial investment can be high, the long-term benefits, such as lower energy costs and reduced dependence on fossil fuels, can be significant. The study showed that households using home batteries can use their self-generated energy more efficiently, leading to a higher degree of self-sufficiency and a lower energy bill. This is particularly beneficial in times of rising energy prices and a growing focus on sustainability. The results of this study are a stimulus for households to invest in solar panels and home batteries, with an eye to a more sustainable future. Energy expert Bram emphasized that the technology is constantly evolving and that the costs of home batteries may further decrease in the future, making the investment even more attractive. 'It is important that consumers are aware of the benefits and possibilities of this technology,' said Bram. 'With the right information and advice, they can make a well-considered decision that contributes to a more sustainable lifestyle.' The Vereniging Eigen Huis will continue to monitor developments in this area and inform households about the latest insights and technologies. This study is an important milestone in the development of sustainable energy solutions for households and underscores the importance of investments in green technologies for a more sustainable future.

title: Waymo's Revolution: New Robotaxi Buses Get Green Light for Passengers
summary:
In the rapidly evolving world of self-driving vehicles, Waymo, a subsidiary of Alphabet Inc., has reached a new milestone. The company recently announced that their new generation of robotaxi buses are ready to transport passengers. This is a significant step forward in the development of self-driving technology, promising a revolution in the way we think about public transportation and individual mobility. 

Waymo's new robotaxi buses are designed to efficiently and safely transport passengers, with a focus on comfort and accessibility. The buses are equipped with advanced sensors and software that enable them to navigate independently through busy urban environments. This is a remarkable achievement, given the complexity of driving in cities like San Francisco and Los Angeles, where Waymo plans to start transporting its own employees. 

The decision to start with transporting employees is a smart move. By first transporting a small, controlled group of passengers, Waymo can thoroughly test their technology and address any issues before opening the buses to the general public. This also allows them to gather feedback from real users, which is crucial for improving the technology. 

The impact of Waymo's new robotaxi buses could be enormous. They can help reduce traffic by providing an efficient alternative to individual cars. They can also improve the accessibility of transportation, especially for people who do not have access to a car or who have difficulty using traditional public transportation. Additionally, they can contribute to a more sustainable future by reducing dependence on fossil fuels. 

Of course, as with any new technology, there are challenges. Acceptance of self-driving vehicles by the general public is not yet guaranteed. There are still questions about safety, privacy, and the impact on the job market. Waymo will need to work to gain the trust of the public and address these concerns. 

But the future looks promising. With their new robotaxi buses, Waymo is at the forefront of the self-driving revolution. And if they succeed, we can expect a world where self-driving vehicles are an integral part of our daily lives, changing the way we travel, work, and live. This is not only a milestone for Waymo but also a big step forward for the entire industry. 

Waymo's new robotaxi buses are ready to transport passengers, and the world is watching. It's an exciting time for the self-driving industry, and we can't wait to see what the future brings.

title: Innovative Bike Bag Lock: A Step Forward in Bike Security
summary:
In an era where bike theft is a growing problem, an innovative solution is hitting the market that specifically targets protecting a often overlooked component: the bike bag. While we are already accustomed to securing our bikes with U-locks, ring locks, and chain locks, and even our batteries can be locked, the bike bag remains an easy prey for thieves. This is now changing thanks to a new company that is revolutionizing the game with the introduction of the bike bag lock. This article delves into the details of this innovation and examines how it can improve the safety of cyclists.

The bike bag is an essential part of daily life for many cyclists. Whether it's for transporting groceries, clothes, or personal belongings, the bike bag offers a convenient solution. However, the conveniences it provides often come with an increased risk of theft. Thieves have quickly realized that bike bags are often left unsecured, making them an easy target. This problem is not new, but until now, there have been few effective solutions to prevent it.

The new bike bag lock offers a simple but effective solution. The lock is designed to be quickly and easily applied without affecting the functionality of the bike bag. It is compatible with most standard bike bags and can be easily installed without tools. This makes it a practical and accessible option for all cyclists, regardless of their technical skills.

One of the main advantages of the bike bag lock is the extra security it provides. By locking the bike bag, it becomes much harder for thieves to steal it. This not only reduces the risk of theft but also contributes to an overall improvement in public space safety. Cyclists can leave their belongings with peace of mind, knowing they are well secured.

In addition to the safety benefits, the bike bag lock also offers several practical advantages. It is lightweight and compact, making it easy to carry around. This makes it ideal for cyclists who often go on the road and want to keep their belongings safe. Furthermore, the lock is made of durable materials, making it resistant to wear and weather conditions, ensuring a long lifespan.

The introduction of the bike bag lock is an important step forward in the safety of cyclists. It offers a simple and effective solution to a problem that has been neglected for too long. By locking the bike bag, cyclists can better protect their belongings and contribute to a safer public space. This is an innovation that not only improves the safety of individual cyclists but also has a positive impact on society as a whole.

In conclusion, the bike bag lock is a welcome addition to the world of bike security. It offers a simple, effective, and accessible solution to a problem that many cyclists face daily. With its durable design and easy installation, it is a must-have for anyone who wants to keep their bike bag safe. Let's hope this innovation paves the way for more improvements in cyclist safety and contributes to a safer and better future for everyone.

title: 15 Simple Travel Gadgets That'll Take the Stress Out of Your Next In-Transit Day
summary:
Traveling can sometimes be a stressful experience, especially if you're not well-prepared. Fortunately, there are countless travel gadgets that can help you make your next trip as smooth as possible. We've rounded up the best travel gadgets for you, from international power adapters to portable luggage scales. Here are 15 simple travel gadgets that'll take the stress out of your next in-transit day.

1. **International Power Adapter**: An international power adapter is a must-have for anyone who travels frequently. With this adapter, you can charge your devices anywhere in the world without worrying about different plug formats.

2. **Portable Luggage Scale**: A portable luggage scale is a handy tool to ensure your luggage isn't too heavy. This can help you avoid extra costs and improve your travel experience.

3. **Travel Adapter**: A travel adapter is a compact solution for charging your devices abroad. It's easy to use and fits in your bag.

4. **Portable Water Bottles**: A portable water bottle is a must-have for anyone going on a trip. It helps you stay hydrated and is eco-friendly.

5. **Travel Organization Set**: A travel organization set helps you keep your belongings organized. It contains various pouches and containers to store your items conveniently.

6. **Portable Charger**: A portable charger is a must-have for anyone who's always on the go. It helps you charge your devices even when there are no outlets available.

7. **Travel Pillow**: A travel pillow is a must-have for anyone taking long flights or train rides. It helps you stay comfortable during your journey.

8. **Earplugs**: Earplugs are a must-have for anyone traveling. They help you sleep peacefully and reduce environmental noise.

9. **Travel First Aid Kit**: A travel first aid kit is a must-have for anyone traveling. It contains various medications and first aid supplies to help you in emergencies.

10. **Portable Wi-Fi Hotspot**: A portable Wi-Fi hotspot is a must-have for anyone traveling. It helps you stay connected to the internet even abroad.

11. **Travel Lock**: A travel lock is a must-have for anyone traveling. It helps you keep your belongings safe and prevents them from being stolen.

12. **Portable Suitcase**: A portable suitcase is a must-have for anyone traveling. It helps you carry and organize your belongings easily.

13. **Travel Laptop Bag**: A travel laptop bag is a must-have for anyone traveling. It helps you keep your laptop safe and organized.

14. **Portable Cooler**: A portable cooler is a must-have for anyone traveling. It helps you keep your food and drinks fresh.

15. **Travel Charger**: A travel charger is a must-have for anyone traveling. It helps you charge your devices even when there are no outlets available.

With these 15 simple travel gadgets, you can take the stress out of your trip and enjoy a smooth and comfortable journey. Whether you're going on vacation or a business trip, these travel gadgets will help you improve your travel experience and enjoy your destination without worries.

title: 28 Best Airbnbs in Puerto Rico: From Beach Pads to Penthouses
summary:

Let's start with a selection of beach huts that bring you closer to nature. These accommodations not only offer stunning ocean views but also a sense of tranquility and serenity. One of the top picks is a small but charming beach hut in Rincón, equipped with a private beach and a wooden deck to admire the sunset. Another notable option is an eco-friendly hut in Cabo Rojo, built entirely from natural materials and offering an authentic experience of the island.

For those seeking a more luxurious experience, there are plenty of penthouses and villas available. Another luxury option is a villa in Dorado, equipped with a private beach and a large pool, ideal for families or groups of friends.

Puerto Rico also offers a wide range of accommodations for those seeking a more adventurous experience. From camping sites in the rainforest to glamping options in the mountains, there's something for everyone. A notable choice is a glamping tent in El Yunque, fully equipped with all modern amenities and offering a unique way to experience nature.

In addition to the accommodations themselves, Puerto Rico also offers a wide range of activities and attractions. From hiking in the rainforest to surfing on the Caribbean waves, there's something for everyone. One of the top attractions is the bioluminescent bay in Fajardo, where you can swim among thousands of glowing organisms at night. Another notable attraction is the old city of San Juan, with its colorful buildings and lively street music.

Whether you're looking for a romantic getaway, a family vacation, or a solo adventure, Puerto Rico offers a wide range of accommodations and activities to make your stay unforgettable. Book your stay in one of these 28 best Airbnbs in Puerto Rico and discover the tropical paradise for yourself.

title: The Best Skiing in Utah: From High-End Resorts to Low-Key Local Mountains
summary:
Utah is renowned for its breathtaking landscapes and world-class ski resorts. Whether you're seeking luxury accommodations or a laid-back, local skiing experience, Utah has something for everyone. In this article, we delve into Utah's top ski resorts, including recommendations for dining, lodging, and après-ski activities. 

**Park City Mountain Resort** 

Park City Mountain Resort is one of the largest ski resorts in the United States, offering over 7,300 acres of ski and snowboard terrain. The resort is perfect for both beginners and advanced skiers, with a wide range of trails and modern lifts. After a day on the slopes, you can enjoy the lively après-ski scene in Park City. There are numerous restaurants and bars where you can savor local specialties and enjoy a drink. For a luxurious experience, you can stay in one of the many high-end hotels or chalets in the area. 

**Deer Valley Resort** 

Deer Valley Resort is known for its exclusive atmosphere and high-quality service. With just 650 acres of terrain, it's smaller than some other resorts but offers a more intimate and luxurious experience. Deer Valley is also one of the few resorts in the United States where skiers can still experience the traditional 'ski-butler' service. After a day on the slopes, you can enjoy delicious meals in one of the resort's restaurants or spend a relaxing evening in one of the luxurious accommodations. 

**Snowbird Ski Resort** 

Snowbird Ski Resort is a paradise for advanced skiers and snowboarders. With its steep trails and challenging terrain, it's a favorite among experienced winter sports enthusiasts. The resort offers a wide range of accommodations, from luxury hotels to cozy chalets. After a day on the slopes, you can enjoy delicious meals in one of the resort's restaurants or spend a relaxing evening in one of the luxurious accommodations. 

**Alta Ski Resort** 

Alta Ski Resort is one of the oldest ski resorts in the United States and is known for its excellent snow conditions. The resort offers a wide range of trails for all levels, from beginners to advanced skiers. title: The Best Things to Do in Mallorca: Shopping, Beaches, and Adventures
summary: Mallorca, the largest island of the Balearics, is a paradise for travelers seeking a mix of relaxation, culture, and adventure. With its crystal-clear waters, spectacular landscapes, and lively cities, Mallorca offers an endless list of activities for every type of traveler. Whether you're a beach lover, a culture enthusiast, or an adventurer, Mallorca has something for everyone. Let's dive into the best things to do on this beautiful island. Beaches Mallorca is famous for its breathtakingly beautiful beaches. The island boasts more than 260 beaches, each with its own unique charm. The most famous beach, Playa de Palma, is a long stretch of sand that is perfect for families and water sports enthusiasts. For those seeking a more tranquil environment, Cala Varques is an excellent choice. This secluded beach is surrounded by cliffs and crystal-clear water, ideal for snorkeling and diving. Culture and History Mallorca has a rich history dating back to Roman times. The capital, Palma de Mallorca, is a must-visit for culture enthusiasts. The cathedral of Palma, also known as La Seu, is an architectural masterpiece that you shouldn't miss. The Palace of l'Almudaina and the Royal Palace of La Almudaina are also notable landmarks worth visiting. For those interested in the history of Mallorca, the Museum of Mallorca is an excellent choice. Shopping Mallorca is a paradise for shoppers. The capital, Palma de Mallorca, has a wide range of shops, from luxury boutiques to local markets. The Passeig des Born is one of the most exclusive shopping streets, where you can find luxury brands. For those looking for local products, the Olivos Market is an excellent choice. Here you can buy local crafts, textiles, and art. Adventure Mallorca is also a paradise for adventurous travelers. The island offers a wide range of activities, from hiking and cycling to water sports and paragliding. The Serra de Tramuntana, a mountain range that stretches across the northwest of the island, is an excellent destination for hikers and cyclists. The range is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and offers spectacular views and breathtaking hikes. For those seeking a more adventurous experience, paragliding is an excellent choice. The island offers some of the best paragliding locations in Europe, with spectacular views over the coastline and the mountains. Food and Drink Mallorca is also known for its delicious cuisine. The island offers a wide range of restaurants, from luxury dining to local tapas bars. The local cuisine is a mix of Spanish and Mediterranean influences, with fresh fish, vegetables, and fruit as the main ingredients. One of the most famous dishes is the sobrassada, a local sausage that is often served with bread and cheese. For those looking for a more luxurious experience, the restaurant Adrián Quetglas is an excellent choice. This restaurant offers a modern interpretation of Mallorcan cuisine, with fresh ingredients and creative dishes. Conclusion Mallorca is an island that has something for everyone. Whether you're looking for relaxation, culture, adventure, or culinary delights, Mallorca has it all. With its crystal-clear waters, spectacular landscapes, and lively cities, Mallorca is a destination not to be missed. Whether you're a first-time visitor or a returning visitor, Mallorca will surely not disappoint.

title: Breakthrough in Nipah Virus Treatment: Clinical Trials for First Vaccine Begin
summary:
In an era where the world grapples with various health challenges, a ray of hope emerges from India. The country, which recently experienced a mini-outbreak of the Nipah virus, is on the brink of a potential breakthrough in the treatment of this often-fatal disease. For the first time in history, clinical trials for a Nipah virus vaccine are beginning, marking a significant step forward in the fight against this public health threat.

The Nipah virus, which is spread through contact between humans and animals, has a high fatality rate and has caused panic in communities where it has broken out in the past. Until now, there has been little that doctors could do for the victims other than normal supportive care procedures such as treating the resulting symptoms, rest, and hydration. The absence of specialized treatment has only heightened the need for a vaccine.

The clinical trials for the Nipah virus vaccine are the result of years of research and development. Scientists and researchers have worked tirelessly to develop an effective vaccine that has the potential to save lives and prevent outbreaks. The commencement of these trials marks a crucial milestone in medical science and offers hope for the future.

The Nipah virus is a rare but serious disease that was first identified in Malaysia in 1998. Since then, there have been several outbreaks in different parts of the world, particularly in South Asia. The disease is transmitted by bats and pigs and can also be spread from person to person, making it difficult to control. The symptoms of the Nipah virus range from mild to severe and can include fever, headache, vomiting, confusion, and in severe cases, coma and death.

The development of a vaccine against the Nipah virus is a complex and challenging task. It requires an in-depth understanding of the virus and the way it attacks the human body. Researchers have explored various strategies, including the use of weakened or killed viruses, genetic technologies, and designing vaccines that specifically target the proteins of the virus. The clinical trials will evaluate the safety and effectiveness of the vaccine and determine if it can be used to prevent the spread of the virus.

The commencement of clinical trials for the Nipah virus vaccine is a significant step forward, but it is important to remember that the development process of a vaccine is long and complex. It can take years before the vaccine is available to the general public, and there are still many obstacles to overcome. Despite these challenges, the commencement of the trials offers hope and inspiration to those grappling with the impact of the Nipah virus.

The international community has recognized the need for a Nipah virus vaccine and has provided support to the researchers and scientists working on the front lines. Organizations such as the World Health Organization (WHO) have emphasized the need for a vaccine and have allocated resources to support its development. Collaboration between countries and organizations is crucial to preventing the spread of the virus and protecting the health of the global population.

The Nipah virus is a serious threat to public health, but the development of a vaccine offers hope for the future. The clinical trials that are now beginning are a testament to human determination to overcome health challenges. It is a reminder of the power of scientific research and the possibility of saving lives and protecting communities. As we await the results of these trials, we can hope for a world where the Nipah virus no longer poses a threat to public health.

title: A Passing 'Angel' Rescues Pregnant Woman from Sinking Car
summary:

He managed to open the doors and helped Appolon out of the sinking vehicle, bringing her safely to the side.

title: Woman is overjoyed that her prosthesis was found after 10 months
summary: Brenda Ogden, a 69-year-old woman from the United Kingdom, has experienced a miraculous and emotional reunion with her prosthesis, which she lost in the North Sea 10 months ago. Ogden's story is an inspiring tale of hope and the power of the sea that has touched the world and helped her find her lost prosthesis. Ogden, who has lived with an amputation for years, had received a new, custom-made titanium prosthesis designed specifically to help her with swimming and other physical activities. One day last April, while preparing to swim in the North Sea, her prosthesis was suddenly swept away by a strong wave. Ogden was devastated, knowing that replacing the prosthesis would be expensive and time-consuming. She had used the prosthesis for months and had built a strong bond with it. She felt like a part of her had been swept away. Ogden did not give up hope and began a search for her lost prosthesis. She sought help from local divers, beach walkers, and even the coast guard. She also posted messages on social media and in local newspapers, hoping that someone would find her prosthesis. Weeks passed, and there was no trace of her prosthesis. Ogden began to doubt whether she would ever find her prosthesis again. But then, one day in February of this year, she received a phone call from a stranger who said he had found her prosthesis. The man, who was walking on the beach, had accidentally found the prosthesis on the beach, precisely where Ogden had lost it. He had taken the prosthesis home and had searched the internet to see if anyone could help him find the owner. Eventually, he came across Ogden's post on social media and decided to call her. Ogden was overwhelmed with joy and could not believe that her prosthesis had been returned after 10 months. She was so grateful for the help of the stranger and for the power of the sea, which had brought her prosthesis back. Ogden said she felt like a part of her had returned and that she would never lose her prosthesis again. She was also overwhelmed with gratitude for the support and love of her family, friends, and the community, who had helped her get through this difficult time. Ogden's story is an inspiring tale of hope and the power of the sea that has touched the world and helped her find her lost prosthesis. It is a reminder that, even in the toughest times, there is always hope and that the power of the sea and the support of others can help us get through. Ogden is now back to swimming and enjoying life with her prosthesis, which she will never lose again. She is also determined to help others who live with an amputation and inspire them to keep going, even in the toughest times. title: Chinese river shows remarkable recovery after 70 years of decline
summary: The world-famous Yangtze, the longest river in Asia and the third longest in the world, is showing significant signs of improvement. After seventy years of decline, the water quality of the river has significantly improved. This remarkable recovery is due to an effective fishing ban that has been in place since 2003. The ban, which extends over an area of 700 kilometers, has led to a spectacular increase in the fish population and an improvement in the overall ecological health of the river. This success story offers hope for other rivers and waterways suffering from overfishing and pollution. The Yangtze, which flows through three provinces and plays a crucial role in the lives of millions of people, is a lifeline for China. The river is not only a source of fresh water but also an important transport route and a source of energy. The improved water quality has not only positive effects on nature but also on human health and the economy. The local population has already been able to experience the benefits of the river's recovery. Fishermen have reported an increase in fish catches, leading to an improved standard of living. Tourists are attracted by the improved water quality and rich biodiversity, contributing to the local economy. The success of the fishing ban on the Yangtze is an example of how effective management measures can contribute to the recovery of an ecosystem. It shows that with the right efforts and dedication, even the most neglected waterways can be restored. This is a beacon of hope for other rivers and waterways suffering from overfishing and pollution. The recovery of the Yangtze is a remarkable success story that demonstrates the power of human efforts and dedication to nature. title: Congress defies Trump on tariffs amid ongoing spat with Canada
summary:
In a rare bipartisan show of defiance, the U.S. House of Representatives has passed a resolution to block President Donald Trump's tariffs on Canada amid rising tensions between the two countries. The resolution, introduced by Representative Gregory Meeks of New York, would rescind the tariffs Trump imposed on Canada under a national emergency declaration. The vote was 219 to 211, with six Republicans joining Democrats to defy Trump and GOP leadership. One Democrat, Representative Jared Golden of Maine, voted against the resolution.

The voting action followed a failed attempt by Republican leaders to block the effort through a procedural maneuver, when three GOP lawmakers sided with Democrats to allow debate to move forward. Trump publicly warned Republicans not to cross him and threatened political retaliation against anyone who voted against tariffs. "Any Republican, in the House or the Senate, that votes against TARIFFS will seriously suffer the consequences come Election time, and that includes Primaries!" Trump wrote on Truth Social ahead of the vote.

Both Republicans and Democrats who opposed the tariffs cite economic impacts as their primary reason. "Today's vote is simple, very simple: Will you vote to lower the cost of living for the American family or will you keep prices high out of loyalty to one person, Donald J. Trump?" said Meeks, the author of the resolution, ahead of the vote. House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries, a Democrat, said in a statement after the vote that "sycophantic Republicans in the House have tried to block us from acting on behalf of the American people" and that Trump's tariffs were "causing prices to skyrocket and creating unnecessary uncertainty for American families."

Republican Don Bacon of Nebraska, who voted against tariffs on Canada alongside the Democrats, said: "As an old-fashioned Conservative I know tariffs are a tax on American consumers." Bacon will be retiring and won't seek reelection in the midterm. The resolution now heads to the Senate. But even if it passes, Trump is expected to veto it, making the effort largely symbolic.

The congressional rebellion comes as Trump's dispute with Canada intensifies. In January, Trump threatened to impose a 100% tariff on Canada after Prime Minister Mark Carney reached a trade agreement with China, which offered China a quota for EV exports in exchange for certain agricultural tariffs on Canada being dropped. Trump then threatened to block the opening of a new bridge between Michigan and Ontario and demanded some ownership of the bridge that Canada paid for.

Although a conversation between Carney and Trump has de-escalated threats on the bridge, it is clear that sentiment toward the U.S. in Canada has soured. According to Statistics Canada, Canadians returning to Canada after traveling in the U.S. took a dive in early 2025 and are down about a quarter from the year before as of November 2025. After Canadian provinces launched a boycott against American alcohol products, U.S. spirits exports to Canada plummeted 85% in the second quarter of 2025 and fell below $10 million in export value, according to the Distilled Spirits Council.

The resolution passed by the House is a rare bipartisan challenge to Trump's trade policy and a sign of growing concern within Congress about the economic impact of Trump's tariffs. It is also a sign of growing dissent within the Republican Party over Trump's trade policy. While the resolution is unlikely to lead to the rescission of the tariffs, it is an important statement from Congress that it does not agree with Trump's approach.

The tensions between the U.S. and Canada have been increasing in recent months, particularly since Trump began his second term. Trump has repeatedly criticized Canada and accused the country of unfair trade practices. He has also threatened further tariffs if Canada does not meet his demands. The tensions have led to a deterioration in relations between the two countries and have affected trade and economic growth.

The resolution passed by the House is a response to Trump's recent tariffs on Canada. In March, Trump imposed tariffs on Canadian steel and aluminum imports, citing national security reasons. The tariffs have led to an increase in the price of steel and aluminum products in the U.S. and have further strained relations between the two countries. The resolution passed by the House is an attempt to block the tariffs and improve relations between the two countries.

The resolution is a rare bipartisan challenge to Trump's trade policy and a sign of growing concern within Congress about the economic impact of Trump's tariffs. title: DeepMind's CEO Works in Two Shifts: 'I Come Alive at 1 a.m.'
summary: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis recently revealed his unique work schedule during an interview at the SXSW London event. Hassabis, a visionary in the world of artificial intelligence, has a peculiar approach to his workday that he has maintained for over a decade. He works in two shifts and sleeps only six hours per night, a routine he has perfected to maximize his creativity and productivity. This approach is not only fascinating but also an example of how top executives manage their time to achieve their goals. Hassabis' day begins with a busy agenda filled with back-to-back meetings, leaving him with almost no time in between. After a day of work, he spends time with his family and has dinner. Then, he starts his second workday at 10 p.m. and works until 4 a.m. During these nighttime hours, he conducts his most creative and research-oriented work. Hassabis explains that he feels most alive at 1 a.m. and develops his best ideas and solutions during these hours. This routine is not only unique but also a testament to his dedication to his work and his ability to manage his time effectively. Hassabis' approach is similar to that of other tech entrepreneurs, such as Elon Musk and Marc Benioff, who have also developed their own unique work schedules to achieve their goals. Musk, for instance, has stated that he functions best with about six hours of sleep, while Benioff averages eight hours of sleep per night. However, Hassabis' routine is unique because he splits his workday into two shifts, allowing him to balance both his professional and personal responsibilities. This approach has enabled him to found and build DeepMind into one of the leading research centers in the field of artificial intelligence. Hassabis' work has contributed to significant breakthroughs in the field, such as the development of tools like Gemini and Nano Banana, and his research on protein structure prediction earned him and his colleague John Jumper the 2024 Nobel Prize in Chemistry. Hassabis' story is an inspiration to aspiring entrepreneurs and professionals who are looking to carve out their own path to success. His ability to manage his time effectively and his dedication to his work are traits that contribute to his success. While his routine may not be suitable for everyone, it offers a glimpse into the world of a top executive and the strategies he uses to achieve his goals. Hassabis' story is a reminder that success does not solely depend on talent and hard work but also on the ability to manage one's time and energy effectively. His unique work schedule is a testament to his dedication and creativity, and it serves as an example of how one can find their own path to success in the world of artificial intelligence and technology.

title: Olympic Skier Tess Johnson: Daily Writing is the Key to Her Performance
summary: Olympic skier Tess Johnson, 25, reveals that a simple daily habit powers her performance — and it doesn't involve the gym. The American mogul skier never travels to competitions without her journal. Johnson journals twice daily — and also carves out time to write before her races. She says journaling gets her in the right headspace and helps her stay present and off her phone. Johnson starts and ends every day with the same ritual that helps her perform under pressure. In an interview with Town & Country Magazine published on Wednesday, the American mogul skier said she always packs her journal when she travels for competitions. 'I do a little bit of journaling in the morning to set my day, set my goals for the day and a little bit of gratitude, but then in the evening I let it all out and it's a little bit like word vomit, but whatever I need to just get out to get a good night of sleep,' Johnson said. Johnson made the US national team at 14 — the youngest athlete to do so at the time — and later became the youngest American freestyle skier to medal at the World Championships. She debuted at the 2018 PyeongChang Olympics and reached the finals at the 2026 Milan Cortina Games, where she finished 10th. Johnson, whose grandfather was a former Sports Illustrated writer who covered the Olympics, said journaling plays a key role in her mental preparation. She believes she inherited her love of writing from her grandfather and now uses journaling as a practical training tool to track her progress in skiing. 'And also an emotional tool to just work through whatever anxieties are happening because this is a very intense sport and process that we're going through,' Johnson said. 'It's really helpful to get it all out on paper and sift through it just by putting pen to paper. So it does a lot for me. And at the very least, it's just a way to stay present and get off my phone from time to time,' she continued. Johnson added that she occasionally rereads her old journals, including those from the 2018 Olympics. 'It's really cool to see the progress I've made over the years,' she said. Apart from being a part of her daily routine, journaling is also a key part of her pre-race ritual. 'The night before I like to journal, whatever in training that day, any other thoughts that I need to get out. Then the morning of, I'll write down three goals for the day, usually relating to my skiing or a mental performance goal, or just something even maybe not related to skiing, just that I have for the day, and then I'll write down a couple things that I'm grateful for as well,' Johnson said, adding that she does her warm ups after that. Johnson isn't the only elite athlete who has embraced journaling as part of their routine. Michael Phelps told Business Insider in 2023 that he uses writing to reflect and unwind, while WNBA star Caitlin Clark has incorporated journaling into her pregame ritual to clear her head and stay focused. Meanwhile, other Olympians are leaning into surprisingly old-school hobbies in their downtime, including cross-country skier Ben Ogden, who said knitting helps him relax.

title: How a developer turned his Mac into an Apple TV Remote you won't lose
summary:
In the world of technology and innovation, it is not uncommon to see how developers and tech enthusiasts use their devices in unique ways. A recent example is Nick Ustinov, a developer who has found a solution to a common problem: losing the remote control of the Apple TV 4K. Instead of constantly searching for the missing remote control, Ustinov decided to use his Mac as an alternative. The Apple TV 4K is a popular device for streaming movies, series, and other content. It offers seamless integration with other Apple products and a user-friendly interface. This can be frustrating, especially when you are in the middle of an exciting movie and you cannot find the remote control.

Nick Ustinov, a developer with a sharp eye for innovation, saw this problem as an opportunity to create something new. He decided to use his Mac as an alternative remote control for his Apple TV 4K. By utilizing the developer resources and tools that Apple offers, Ustinov was able to develop an application that enables his Mac to communicate with his Apple TV. This means that he can now use his Mac to browse through channels, use the volume control, and even access other features that are normally only available via the remote control.

The process to achieve this was not simple. Ustinov had to write various programs and scripts to facilitate the communication between his Mac and Apple TV. He used Apple's HomeKit framework, which allows developers to integrate their devices with other Apple products. By utilizing this framework, Ustinov was able to create a usable and reliable solution that enables his Mac to function as a remote control for his Apple TV.

The impact of Ustinov's work is significant. It not only provides a solution to the problem of lost remote controls but also opens the door to new possibilities in the way we communicate with our devices. It shows how developers can innovate and find new solutions to everyday problems. It is an example of how technology can be used to make our lives easier and more efficient.

With the continuous development of new technologies and the growing integration of devices, we can expect developers to find new ways to use our devices. In conclusion, Nick Ustinov's creation is a remarkable example of how technology and innovation can work together to solve everyday problems. It is an inspiring story that shows us that there is always a way to improve things, even if it is something as simple as losing a remote control.

title: How Spain is Preparing for the August Solar Eclipse: A Guide for Eclipse Chasers
summary:

This rare event has already sparked a wave of excitement among astronomers and adventurers, and Spain is preparing to welcome these masses. Here's what you need to know before you go. 

The 2026 total solar eclipse will be one of the most accessible for European tourists, with a shadow path that runs through Spain, Portugal, and part of Morocco. Spain, with its rich culture, diverse landscapes, and excellent infrastructure, is set to become one of the best destinations for eclipse chasers. 

Preparations are already underway. Local governments, tourism boards, and scientific institutions are working together to ensure everything runs smoothly. Second, it is advisable to keep an eye on the weather forecasts, as the visibility of the eclipse depends on clear weather. 

The eclipse itself will be an unforgettable experience. During the total phase, which will last approximately two minutes, day will suddenly turn into night. The temperature will drop, and the surroundings will take on a mystical atmosphere. This is a moment you will not forget, and Spain offers the perfect location to experience this phenomenon. 

In addition to the scientific and cultural aspects, Spain also offers a culinary and social experience not to be missed. title: Heroic Neighbor Rescues 85-year-old Woman from Burning House with Sledgehammer

With a powerful blow, he broke down the door and entered the house, where he found the 85-year-old woman in her wheelchair.

title: Bird Droppings as a Power Source: The Rise of an Unknown Coastal Kingdom Unveiled
summary:
In the world of archaeology, there are often surprising discoveries that provide insight into the complex societies of the past. Recent research has brought to light that bird droppings, specifically guano, played a crucial role in the rise of one of the most influential pre-Incan societies along the Peruvian coast. This discovery, made by Dr. Jacob Bongers, an archaeologist specializing in Andean cultures, has surprised the scientific community and offers a new perspective on how natural resources have shaped the course of history. 

Dr. Bongers' research focuses on the coastal region of Peru, where ancient Andean cultures thrived. One of the greatest challenges for these societies was improving soil fertility to practice agriculture. The Peruvian coast is known for its poor, dry soil, which is little suited for intensive agriculture. However, the ancient Andeans found a way to overcome this challenge, and that was by using guano, the droppings of seabirds. 

Guano is an extremely nutritious fertilizer, rich in nitrogen, phosphorus, and other essential nutrients that stimulate plant growth. The ancient Andeans collected guano from the islands off the coast and used it to fertilize their fields. This resulted in a significant increase in agricultural production, which in turn enabled the growth of complex societies. 

Dr. Bongers' discovery is based on extensive archaeological research, including the analysis of ancient fields, potsherds, and other artifacts. He has also studied historical sources to gain insight into how the ancient Andeans used guano and how this influenced their societies. His research shows that guano was not only important in agriculture but also in the politics and economy of ancient Andean societies. 

One of the most remarkable findings of Dr. Bongers is that control over guano-rich islands was a source of power and wealth. Societies that had access to these islands could increase their agricultural production and thus support their population. This led to greater political and military power, allowing these societies to expand and dominate other groups. 

Dr. Bongers' discovery also has implications for our current understanding of sustainability and environmental management. The ancient Andeans had a deep understanding of the natural cycle and knew how to use the resources of their environment responsibly. Their use of guano was not only a means to increase their agricultural production but also a way to manage and preserve the natural resources of their environment. 

This discovery is a reminder that the history of humanity is not only shaped by great events and conflicts but also by the small, often unnoticed details of daily life. The ancient Andeans found a way to use the droppings of seabirds to strengthen and grow their societies. Their story is an inspiration to us all, to learn from the past and find applications for our current challenges. 

Dr. Bongers' research is an important contribution to our understanding of ancient Andean cultures and their influence on world history. It is a reminder that the natural resources of our environment can be a powerful source of power and wealth, and that we learn from the past to build a more sustainable future.

title: Revolutionary paint aids drought-stricken regions: cooling and water conservation in one
summary:

This is a breakthrough that can offer a hopeful future, especially for drought-stricken regions. 

The paint, recently developed by a team from the University of Melbourne, combines the properties of cool paint and a water-absorbing coating. Cool paint is already known for its ability to cool surfaces by reflecting infrared radiation, significantly lowering the temperature of buildings and streets. But this new paint goes a step further by also absorbing and storing water from the air, making it available for plants and other uses. 

The impact of this paint is enormous. In areas where water is scarce and temperatures soar, this paint can be a lifeline. By lowering the temperature, it reduces the need for air conditioning, which in turn decreases energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions. Moreover, the water storage function provides a valuable source of water for irrigation and other purposes. 

The paint is made from eco-friendly materials and is designed to be durable and cost-effective. This makes it a feasible solution for both developed and developing countries. The researchers have already seen positive results in pilot projects in drought-stricken areas in Australia, where the paint has contributed to a significant temperature drop and improved water availability. 

The future of this paint is promising. The researchers are now working on optimizing the formula and expanding the applications. They hope that this paint can be deployed on a large scale to mitigate the impact of drought and heat, contributing to a more sustainable future. 

This innovation is an example of how science and technology can work together to tackle the biggest challenges of our time. It is a step forward in the fight against climate change and an inspiration for other researchers and inventors around the world. title: A US Army general says new command tech lets him ditch the 'hourlong staff meeting' - NGC2 has been developed through an iterative process involving soldiers, leadership, and command.
summary:
The US Army's new command and control system is giving commanders more access and information for decision-making. The platform is being iteratively developed between the Army and industry through a series of tests. The Army has prioritized breaking down communication walls while developing NGC2.

New US Army warfighting software is speeding up and simplifying the command job, a commander said recently, sharing that it lets him scrap the 'hourlong staff meetings' to make decisions. The Army, like other services, believes that future wars will be determined by the speed of decision-making. That's where the new Next Generation Command and Control, or NGC2, program is expected to make a substantial impact and modernize how the service fights.

At Fort Carson, Colorado, the Army's 4th Infantry Division has been testing NGC2 in a series of exercises. The most recent one, Ivy Sting 4, added more components to the system, with different types of sensors and weapons on the battlefield feeding into one system that everyone can access.

"So it's all in one place, and it's there very, very quickly, so that the staff can see it across their functional systems," said Maj. Gen. Patrick Ellis, commander of the 4th ID, at a recent media roundtable, explaining that "the fires person can see what the logistician sees, can see what the intel person sees." 

"I don't have to have the hourlong staff meeting anymore," the general said.

The Army's new NGC2 system is predicting supply needs and simulating enemy actions.

"If we're actually using the technology as the tool that we're prepping on and that we're also fighting on," he said, "I could sit there, I can look at it, I can make decisions, I can say, 'Hey, here are my priorities for this or that.' We all agree on it, we click save, and that's done."

The Army has facilitated the development of NGC2 with both the 4th ID and 25th Infantry Division in Hawaii and industry teams, including Anduril and Lockheed Martin, pursuing a Silicon Valley-style approach aimed at moving faster and rapidly integrating soldier feedback, delivering fixes immediately rather than months or years later.

On the heels of Ivy Sting 4, more than two weeks of field testing that involved live-fire exercises and an electronic warfare jamming scenario, Ellis and others said that NGC2 was making planning and executing battlefield missions more effective.

"We are no longer fighting with the network; we are now fighting using the network," Ellis said.

During the Ivy Sting 4 testing event, 20 different types of sensors, such as drones, electronic warfare systems, artillery, and Stryker vehicles, were linked together.

The latest live-fire exercise included a variety of systems, weapons, drones, and capabilities.

Data and artificial intelligence capabilities provide real-time information on the sensors. Soldiers can see how much ammunition they've got left or whether a Stryker will need maintenance or fuel soon. Simulations can predict what resources will be needed for certain tactics or actions, including different ways an enemy might attack.

As different platforms are brought onto NGC2, broadening what the platform can do, Army command and soldiers can see and communicate using the same data. The system is breaking down the silos that have previously hindered information flow.

"I'm feeling empowered as a commander to make more, better, and faster decisions because I've got access to all that data," Ellis explained.

Many NGC2 components are being built with off-the-shelf technology and standard commercial software practices, and the vendor teams involved are working on the ground with soldiers. The closer working relationship means soldier feedback is being incorporated more quickly.

"We work through these obstacles, and we learn how to do something, and once we run into a roadblock, we figure out a way to solve that problem, and then that problem is now solved for the Army," he said. "We're not relearning these lessons over and over again."

Read the original article on Business Insider.

title: AI in the workplace is expanding responsibilities and intensifying work - Research by the Haas School of Business found that AI expands responsibilities in the workplace.
summary:
Research by the UC Berkeley Haas School of Business found that AI expanded responsibilities in the workplace. The study on a company with 200 employees found that workers multitasked more and worked longer. Sam Altman had previously addressed how AI accelerates the work cycle in an interview.

If you think using AI means doing less at work, think again. In a new eight-month study of how generative AI changed work habits at a US-based tech company with about 200 employees, researchers at the University of California, Berkeley Haas School of Business found that employees' work intensified in three main ways. Employees multitasked more, took on a broader range of responsibilities, and worked longer hours, often without being asked to do so.

Aruna Ranganathan, a professor in management at UC Berkeley, and Xingqi Maggie Ye, a Ph.D. student at the Haas School of Business, detailed their research in a Harvard Business Review story, writing that once AI tools became available, workers began to usurp each other's roles, feed information to AI during meetings, and correct each other's vibe coding projects. 'Workers described this as 'just trying things' with the AI, but these experiments accumulated into a meaningful widening of job scope,' wrote Ranganathan and Ye. 'In fact, workers increasingly absorbed work that might previously have justified additional help or head count.'

The researchers wrote that many workers also send prompts to AI before leaving their desk for a meeting or for lunch break, so AI could continue to work without supervision. 'These actions rarely felt like doing more work, yet over time they produced a workday with fewer natural pauses and a more continuous involvement with work,' Ranganathan and Ye added.

In an October 2025 interview with Rowan Cheung, who hosts the Rowan's Notes interview series, Sam Altman, the OpenAI CEO, also shared ways in which AI may have made his work more intense. 'It's almost like, I don't think I can come up with ideas fast enough anymore,' Altman told Cheung. 'I really do have a hard time trying to reason through exactly what this is going to mean. I think it will mean that stuff just happens faster and that you can try a lot more stuff and figure out the better ideas quickly.'

title: Failing fast is a lot harder than it sounds - Some companies are adopting a fail-fast mentality
summary: Irish playwright Samuel Beckett's famous quote, 'Ever tried. Ever failed. No matter. Try again. Fail again. Fail better.', has become Corporate America's new mantra. From Okta to Salesforce to Blackstone, executives told BI's Sarah E. Needleman and Ana Altchek that getting it wrong is ok. Just do it quickly and learn from it. The tech industry has always been a big proponent of failing fast, but Corporate America is now catching on thanks to AI. The technology allows companies to quickly launch new tools to a wide group. And, perhaps more importantly, it's a way for executives to prove the big money they are spending on AI isn't going to waste. (Hence why they want you to fail fast.) It's not just for launching products either. Even the ideation phase can be quickly sped up with chatbots that can talk through ideas. What previously might have taken executives (or, more likely, their underlings) hours of research can get figured out a lot faster. There are still some hurdles with the fail-fast approach. What does failing even look like? There isn't a big, red alarm that goes off every time an AI project fails. (Although that sure would be fun.) Executives will say they set clear guidelines for a prototype beforehand, but a tool's benefits can be nuanced. And maybe you just need a little bit more time to really make it sing. All that makes it a lot harder to decide when to pull the plug. The rush to get things out can lead to the belief you'll just fix things on the fly. But that's a dangerous precedent. Just ask the video game industry. When games came in physical copies you had to blow on to get working, companies made sure their product was bulletproof. Nowadays, they can digitally ship a game knowing an update for a glitch won't be far behind. It's a dangerous game that can cause major headaches. A formalized product launch slows things down, but it also makes sure everyone is on the same page. A massive greenlight risks a lack of standardization. That might not seem like a big deal for a prototype. It becomes a bigger problem down the road if the product needs to be reconfigured to fit into the company's wider tech stack.

title: Forget WhatsApp: this free retro-alternative offers off-grid option
summary:
In a world where we are increasingly dependent on the internet and mobile connections, it is refreshing to discover an alternative that allows us to stay in touch without these technologies. Meshtastic is such an innovative and free alternative that uses a peer-to-peer mesh network to enable communication without the internet or mobile data. This article delves deeper into what Meshtastic is, how it works, and why it can be a valuable addition to our communication capabilities.

Meshtastic is an open-source project designed to create a decentralized network where users can communicate directly with each other without relying on central servers or internet providers. Instead, Meshtastic uses a mesh network, where each device (or 'node') acts as a router. When a message is sent, it is passed from node to node until it reaches the intended recipient. This means you can still communicate even in areas with poor or no mobile coverage, as long as there are a number of nodes nearby.

To use Meshtastic, you need a special device, such as the Meshtastic prototype or other compatible hardware. These devices are equipped with a microcontroller and a radio frequency module that enables short-range communication. Although this means you need to purchase an additional device, Meshtastic offers a unique and reliable way to stay in touch, especially in situations where traditional communication methods are not available.

One of the biggest advantages of Meshtastic is the ability to communicate off-grid. This is particularly useful in emergency situations, while camping, or in areas with limited infrastructure. Because the network is decentralized, it is also much harder to censor or hack, making it a safe option for users who value their privacy. Additionally, Meshtastic is completely free and open-source, meaning anyone can contribute to the development and improvement of the project.

While Meshtastic is still in development and may not offer all the features you are used to from apps like WhatsApp, it provides a unique and valuable way to stay in touch without relying on the internet or mobile data. It is an inspiring example of how technology can be used to connect us, even in the most challenging circumstances. Whether you are looking for a reliable way to stay in touch during an emergency, or are simply interested in exploring new communication options, Meshtastic is definitely worth a try.

title: Humanoid robots are fun, but China is betting on an older concept - Many tech companies are currently working on robots that resemble humans and take over tasks that we ourselves have little interest in. But in China, they are focusing on so-called quadrupeds: robot dogs that sometimes run faster than Usain Bolt.
summary:
In the world of technology and innovation, humanoid robots are currently a hot topic. Many tech companies worldwide are working on the development of robots that resemble humans and take over tasks that we ourselves have little interest in. Think of cleaning houses, performing dangerous tasks, or assisting with medical procedures. These robots are designed to make our lives easier and safer. But while the rest of the world is focusing on humanoid robots, China is taking a different approach: quadrupeds, or robot dogs.

Quadrupeds are robots that walk on four legs, similar to dogs. They are designed to move quickly and efficiently, even on uneven terrain. Some of these robot dogs can even run faster than the fastest man in the world, Usain Bolt. This is an impressive feat and shows how far technology has advanced.

The advantages of quadrupeds are numerous. They are versatile and can be used in a wide range of applications. Think of their use in agriculture, where they can help with crop care or data collection. They can also be deployed in industry, where they can perform dangerous tasks that would otherwise have to be done by humans. Additionally, they can be used in the healthcare sector, where they can assist in patient care or perform medical procedures.

Another advantage of quadrupeds is that they are much more stable than humanoid robots. They have a lower center of gravity and can better adapt to uneven terrain. This makes them ideal for use in environments where humanoid robots may not be able to function.

Moreover, quadrupeds are also much cheaper than humanoid robots. This makes them more accessible to a wider audience and allows for their implementation on a larger scale. This is especially important in countries like China, where the demand for technology and innovation is enormous.

The technology behind quadrupeds is also much simpler than that of humanoid robots. This means they require less maintenance and break down less often. This is a big advantage, especially in environments where maintenance and repairs are difficult.

But perhaps the biggest advantage of quadrupeds is that they are much less intimidating than humanoid robots. They resemble animals more than humans, making them less intimidating for people who might be afraid of robots that resemble humans. This is especially important in environments where people might be afraid of technology or might not trust technology.

In short, while the rest of the world is focusing on humanoid robots, China is taking a different approach: quadrupeds. These robots are versatile, stable, affordable, and easy to maintain. They can be deployed in a wide range of applications and are less intimidating than humanoid robots. It is a smart choice for China to invest in this technology, and it is a choice that may well determine the future of robotics.

Dick Griffith's passing is a great loss to the community of adventurers and nature lovers, but his spirit and his passion for adventure will always be with us. We will never forget him, and his legacy will live on in the stories he told and the lives he touched.

title: How to Have the Perfect Week
summary:
It's easy to fall into the trap of only striving for the spectacular highlights of life. We are often inspired by the big moments, such as weddings, travels, or other special events. But what if we focus on the 'ordinary' weeks, which can be just as fulfilling? Let's take a look at how we can create a perfect week, filled with small joys and meaningful moments.

A perfect week starts with setting realistic expectations. It's not about creating a week full of spectacular events, but about finding joy in the daily routine. Start each day with a moment of stillness, whether it's a cup of coffee while watching the sunrise, or a short meditation. This helps you to start the day with a calm and focused mind.

Next, it's important to take time for the things that you truly value. Whether it's a hobby, spending time with family or friends, or just a moment for yourself. Consciously schedule these activities in your agenda, just like you would schedule an appointment. This ensures that you make time for the things that make you happy.

A perfect week also includes time for self-care. This can range from a long walk in nature, a relaxing bath, or simply an extra night's sleep. Self-care is not selfish; it's necessary to relax and recharge. It's also important to learn to say no to other commitments when you know you need time for yourself.

Furthermore, it's essential to find a balance between work and private life. Try to set clear boundaries between your work and your personal life. This might mean not taking your work home, or consciously making time to relax and enjoy your free time. A perfect week is a week where you don't overwork yourself and you have time to enjoy the things you like.

Finally, a perfect week is a week where you can cultivate gratitude. Take the time to think about the things you are grateful for, whether it's your health, your family, or just the small joys of life. This can help to shift your focus from what you lack to what you have, and can lead to a greater sense of contentment and happiness.

A perfect week is not necessarily a week full of spectacular events. It's about finding joy in the daily routine, making time for the things you value, and cultivating gratitude. By following these simple steps, you can create a perfect week, filled with small joys and meaningful moments.

title: The Best Place to See Great Tennis? Anywhere But the Grand Slams - From Arizona to Japan, These Underrated Tennis Tournaments Are Worth Planning a Trip Around
summary:
